input_data.title: Kingdom
input_data.overview: A raw family drama set against the world of Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) in Venice, California. Alvey Kulina owns Navy St. MMA with the help of his girlfriend Lisa Prince. He is willing to go through extraordinary means to make sure his fighters are taken care of, but all of this responsibility comes at a steep price. He has complicated relationships with both of his sons, Jay and Nate, who are both struggling with their own identities and places within Alveyâ€™s life and gym.

response.analytical_summary: Kingdom is a gritty family drama centered around the world of mixed martial arts. The series explores the complex dynamics between a gym owner, his sons, and the fighters he represents, delving into themes of ambition, loyalty, and the sacrifices made in pursuit of success. The show blends the intensity of MMA with the emotional weight of familial relationships, creating a suspenseful and often heartbreaking narrative. It examines the personal costs of striving for greatness and the challenges of maintaining integrity within a competitive and demanding environment. The series offers a raw and realistic portrayal of the MMA world and the people who inhabit it.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Alvey Kulina, a gym owner struggling to keep his MMA gym afloat while battling personal demons and financial pressures. His relationship with his sons, Jay and Nate, is strained, with Jay grappling with his own identity and Nate seeking his father's approval. As the gym gains prominence, Alvey's methods become increasingly questionable, leading to conflicts with his fighters and his family. Lisa Prince, Alvey's girlfriend and a key figure in the gym's operations, navigates the complexities of their relationship and the demands of the MMA world. Throughout the series, rivalries emerge, both inside and outside the ring, forcing Alvey to make difficult choices that impact the lives of everyone around him. The narrative explores the consequences of ambition and the toll it takes on personal relationships, culminating in a series of betrayals and confrontations that reshape the gym's future and the fates of its key players. The series concludes with a resolution to the central conflicts, but leaves the future of the gym and the family uncertain, hinting at ongoing struggles and the enduring impact of past decisions.
response.keyword_sentence: Kingdom is a gritty and intense sports drama set in modern-day Venice, California, exploring themes of family dynamics, ambition, and sacrifice within the competitive world of mixed martial arts.
